1.SceneDescription: Central Perk, Rachel, Phoebe, Joey, Ross, and Monica are all there as ChandlerNEWLINEenters wearing glasses.

lines.Line: Are you kidding? Okay, I’ll give you a hint; I’ll give you aNEWLINEhint. (Points to his glasses.
Eyes! No, no. Your eyes! No. Chandler’s eyes
Eyes! No, no. Your eyes! No. Chandler’s eyes
Yeah-yeah, did-didn’t you use to have a pair? They were reallyNEWLINEround, burgundy, and they made you look kind of umm
Sweetie, I think the glasses look great. They make you look really sexy
(sitting down on the arm of her chair) You didn’t think I used toNEWLINEwear glasses, right
Of course! (She mouths, I have no idea, to the rest of theNEWLINEgang.

2.SceneDescription: Central Perk, Chandler and Monica are there. He takes off his glasses andNEWLINEstarts chewing on the ear piece.

lines.Line: Do you know what I was thinkin’
Nothing, I just like to go like this. (Does it again.
(entering from the bathrooms) Hey Chandler, what are you doing tonight
Uh why, do you have a lecture
Uh why, do you have a lecture
Uh why, do you have a lecture
Then free as a bird. What’s up
Then free as a bird. What’s up
My dad wanted to know if you wanted to play racquetball with us
Wow! That’s great! Dad must really like you, he doesn’t askNEWLINEjust anyone to play
Yeah and he didn’t really ask for you, he asked for Chancy, I assumedNEWLINEhe meant you
No, I-I thought it would be more fun this way
This is so cool, maybe this is something you can do every week
Or you can sit with him on the front porch and make sure no one steals theNEWLINEtrash cans. He does that every week too
Oh, just so you know, you-you have to let him win
Oh, just so you know, you-you have to let him win
Oh, just so you know, you-you have to let him win
Oh no problem, maybe I’ll play with my left hand

lines.Character: (Phoebe enters, walks up to Monica, and exhales exasperatedly
lines.Line: Phoebe enters, walks up to Monica, and exhales exasperatedly.
I just went to my old apartment to get you the-the cookie recipe and theNEWLINEstupid fire burned it up
No!! Why didn’t you make a copy and-and keep it in a fireproof boxNEWLINEand keep it at least a hundred yards from the original?!
(pauses as he figures out how to answer that) Because I’m normal!NEWLINEThat was the one legacy my grandmother left me, and I know you wanted it as anNEWLINEengagement present
Oh, we have to get you an engagement present
Oh, we have to get you an engagement present
Oh, we have to get you an engagement present
Oh, we have to get you an engagement present
No one got me an engagement present
Okay, here I wish you health and happiness. (She hands Monica a cookieNEWLINEin a plastic baggie.)
(To Chandler) This is what happens when you don’t register forNEWLINEgifts
See no-no, I made a batch and I froze it, and this is the only one left
See no-no, I made a batch and I froze it, and this is the only one left
No! Wait! I think I can figure out the recipe from this cookie! I doNEWLINEstuff like this at work all the time
Yeah! I bet I can do it
Yeah! I bet I can do it

lines.Character: (Chandler looks over and sees Ross glaring at them
lines.Line: Chandler looks over and sees Ross glaring at them.
Okay, we owe you a present
Okay, we owe you a present

3.SceneDescription: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe's, Monica and Phoebe are trying to determine theNEWLINEcookie recipe by eating small pieces.

lines.Line: All right, I definitely taste nutmeg
You don’t? (Laughs) Well, that’s the difference between aNEWLINEprofessional and a layman
I don’t want to talk about it. Y’know, you could’ve atNEWLINEleast saved me a whole cookie. (He grabs what’s left of the cookie and pops in hisNEWLINEmouth.
(recoils in horror) Women are mean!!! (Storms out.
(recoils in horror) Women are mean!!! (Storms out.
I can’t believe that! Now the only thing left of myNEWLINEgrandmother’s legacy is this crumb. (She picks it up with her finger and holds it outNEWLINEto Monica.) I wish you a long and happy marriage
Well I had a great time! Umm, Chancy on the other hand
I will tell the story! It was going great. I let him win. WeNEWLINEwere bonding. He even said I could call him dad
And what did he ask you not to call him
And what did he ask you not to call him
And what did he ask you not to call him

Daddy. All right look, here’s the story. (Flashback to ChandlerNEWLINEabout to enter the steam room as he does the voice-over.) Well, we had just finishedNEWLINEplaying racquetball and we were gonna take a steam. I walk into the steam room and it wasNEWLINEreally steamy. (The flashback shows his glasses fog up and him trying to find his wayNEWLINEaround the steam-filled room. He takes off his glasses.) So I take off my glasses andNEWLINEthat’s when it happened

lines.Character: [Cut to the flashback, Chandler’s no longer doing the voice-over
lines.Line: Cut to the flashback, Chandler’s no longer doing the voice-over.

lines.Character: [Cut to the flashback, Chandler’s no longer doing the voice-over
lines.Line: Cut to the flashback, Chandler’s no longer doing the voice-over.
Over here. (You can see Ross sitting at the far wall.

Have a seat son. (You can see Mr. Geller sitting closer to the doorNEWLINEas Chandler walks over and sits in his lap.) Hey!! (Chandler quickly jumps off and sitsNEWLINEnext to him with a shocked expression on his face.

4.SceneDescription: Central Perk, Chandler, Ross, and Rachel are there.

lines.Line: (getting up) All right, I’m off to see your dad
Whoa-whoa, aren’t you a little over dressed
(laughing) Yeah, and-and you better make sure he tips you this time
(laughing) Yeah, and-and you better make sure he tips you this time

Look, I figured I would try to convince him not to tell the storyNEWLINEanymore, and I figure the best way to do that is face to face—And by face INEWLINEdon’t mean his lap. And by face, I don’t mean my ass. (Exits.
(To Rachel) Hey are you getting Monica and Chandler an engagement present
I don’t know. Y’know, they didn’t get us anything
I don’t know. Y’know, they didn’t get us anything
Well hello! So, when are we gettin’ back out on the water matey?
Oh uh, I don’t know the boat way to say this, but uh never
Because! You’re mean on the boat
What? I was just trying to teach you
What? I was just trying to teach you
Well, lesson learned! Rachel is mean
Well, lesson learned! Rachel is mean
Yeeeeeep… Yep-yep-yep-yep-yep. I remember when she took me out on herNEWLINEdad’s boat she wouldn’t let me help at all
Excuse me, I wanted you to help, but you couldn’t move your armsNEWLINEbecause you were wearing three life jackets
You have to respect the sea! (Storms off.
You have to respect the sea! (Storms off.

Look Joey, I’m sorry if-if you thought that was mean, but I gottaNEWLINEtell ya something. That was not mean. Okay, my father is mean. He used to yell at me allNEWLINEthe time on the boat, I mean it was horrible. I was just being a good teacher
Does a good teacher say, Put down the beer pinhead!
Does a good teacher say, Put down the beer pinhead!
Well, does a good student drink seven beers during his first lesson
Six and a half! You knocked that last one out of my hand! Remember
Six and a half! You knocked that last one out of my hand! Remember
Yeah, I didn’t want you to get hit by the boom
Yeah, I didn’t want you to get hit by the boom
Well it hit me anyway! And it would’ve hurt a lot less if I hadNEWLINEfinished that last beer
All right, y’know what? I-I’m sorry. I will try to tone itNEWLINEdown and uh stop yelling
You won’t boss me around anymore
You won’t boss me around anymore
You won’t boss me around anymore
Do you want me to learn?
Do you want me to learn?

5.SceneDescription: The Mr. Bowmont, it's Joey’s second lesson with Rachel as the residentNEWLINEsailing expert.

lines.Line: Okay Joey honey, you’re doing really good! All right, now I’mNEWLINEjust gonna need you to step to the port side. (Joey pauses as he tries to remember whichNEWLINEside is the port side.) Remember? Remember how we talked about the port side
It’s left sweetie, but that’s okay sweetie, that’s aNEWLINEtough one
I don’t know why you just don’t say left
I don’t know why you just don’t say left
Okay, go to the left. (Joey goes starboard or sits on the right side ofNEWLINEthe boat.) The left
(yelling) Just sit over there!! (Points to the port side.
(hurrying over) Okay! Okay, you’re yelling again! See that
(hurrying over) Okay! Okay, you’re yelling again! See that
No! No-no, no-no-no, very quiet, said with love, no yelling
Oh, y’know what? Since I’m here, I think I’m gonna have meNEWLINEa little beer on the port side. (Grabs and opens one.

Okay Joey, we’re luffing a little bit, so could you tighten up theNEWLINEcunningham? (The mainsail has started to flap in the wind and has stopped workingNEWLINEefficiently; she wants him to tighten it so that it starts working again.
Uh, wow, you just said a bunch of stuff I didn’t know there
Uh, wow, you just said a bunch of stuff I didn’t know there
Joey, come on! We just went over this! (She does it instead.
Joey, come on! We just went over this! (She does it instead.
Oh, y’know, when we did that was when that bird was flying overheadNEWLINEwith the fish in his mouth. Did you see it? It was gross

(angrily) No! All right?! I did not see the bird! I did notNEWLINEsee the fish! I did not see the piece of Styrofoam that was shaped like Mike Tyson!NEWLINEI did not, because I was trying to teach you how to sail a boat! WhichNEWLINEobviously is an impossible thing to do
All right that’s it! You’re yelling and I don’t see youNEWLINEtaking your top off! I quit
All right that’s it! You’re yelling and I don’t see youNEWLINEtaking your top off! I quit
What do you mean you quit?! You can’t quit
What do you mean you quit?! You can’t quit
Because you’re not finished yet and I won’t have it! Greens doNEWLINEnot quit
Greens? I’m a Tribbiani! And Tribbianis quit
Greens? I’m a Tribbiani! And Tribbianis quit
Oh my God, wait did I—I just said Greens don’t quitNEWLINEdidn’t I? (Pause) (Angrily) Did I just say Greens don’t quit?
Yes! Yes! You did and you’re still yelling at me
Yes! Yes! You did and you’re still yelling at me

No! No! No! I’m not yelling at you, I’m just yelling near you.NEWLINEOh God Joey, oh I’m my father. Oh my God, this is horrible! I’ve been trying soNEWLINEhard not to be my mother I did not see this comin’. Oh, Joey, I’m sorry.NEWLINEI’m so sorry. I just wanted you to learn
Yeah, it’s okay. I know what a mainsail is. (Points to it. It’sNEWLINEthe larger sail.) I know, I know to duck when the boom comes across. I-I know port isNEWLINEright

6.SceneDescription: The Gym, Chandler and Mr. Geller are heading for the whirlpool room.

lines.Line: So you understand, I’d feel a lot more comfortable if youNEWLINEdidn’t tell people what happened. Y’know, I’m a little…I’m aNEWLINElittle embarrassed about it

I understand completely, there’s nothing more horrifying thanNEWLINEembarrassing yourself in front of your in-laws. As a matter of fact, when I started datingNEWLINEJudy I was unemployed, and her father asked me what I did for a living and I told him INEWLINEwas a lawyer
What did you do when they found out
What did you do when they found out
They never did, so if you ever see me giving them legal advice just nodNEWLINEalong. Shall we?

lines.Character: (Chandler nods along and they enter the whirlpool room and remove their robes. OnlyNEWLINEChandler is lacking a certain item of clothing. You see this is a coed whirlpool, whichNEWLINEmeans swimsuits, and in fact there are two women already there and Chandler didn’tNEWLINEseem to wear his. Needless to say, everyone is shocked, including Chandler
